column1: We’re all eager to spend time with our families this holiday season but let’s make sure we put health and safety first. Family gatherings carry a big risk of infection. Take all of the precautions to stay safe wear a mask and maintain social distance. https://t.co/OFwOmGwkw2

COVID has had a disproportionately devastating economic and social impact on working women mothers and female caregivers and it’s getting worse as our economy struggles and the virus continues to spread. It is affecting every aspect of their lives.  https://t.co/PQ3zbNoIqh

Unfortunately that’s easier said than done for the countless Americans struggling with addiction. COVID is going to have a silver bullet. We’ll have a vaccine and it’s going to be here soon. But there will never be a vaccine for addiction and that’s why I won’t stop fighting.

Whether we’re white Black or Brown Republican Democrat or Independent COVID-19 and addiction are indiscriminate killers. It’s so important for us to ensure that we’re coping in a healthy and productive way as COVID-19 impacts our daily lives. https://t.co/g9mSktz6JF
Things will get worse before they get better and it falls on us to remain vigilant. Wear a mask. Social distance. Do whatever you can to stop the spread. Lives depend on it.

As the virus continues to spike in MD I'm thankful that we're using innovative solutions to help stop the spread. The new MD COVID Alert app is a helpful and secure tool to keep all of us healthy and informed. To learn more about the app click below.  https://t.co/mDvOjyBIqS

Today I'm optimistic. We'll soon have leaders dedicated to solving the critical issues we face like the COVID-19 pandemic the addiction crisis our health and mental health and improving our education system. I am confident we will accomplish this.  https://t.co/991tQCGhsI

The truth is Black and Latinx neighborhoods have seen higher numbers of unemployment food insecurity and evictions throughout this pandemic. These families have been left behind by our government for decades and COVID-19 has made it even worse.  https://t.co/RlPY8H2Oxi

Today I learned from small business owners in Hagerstown how they're adapting during COVID-19. Businesses like these are the backbone of our economy. It’s time for the President and the Senate to quit stalling and support these entrepreneurs. https://t.co/oPWxO83LI1

Many states are being crushed by COVID-19: ND “is leading the nation in new coronavirus cases per capita hospitalizations and deaths are at a high.“ We’re better than that. Let’s keep it up. Be safe. Follow the experts not ideologues. And wear a mask. https://t.co/1BqkWHMMYN

The opioid crisis doesn’t discriminate. It’s taking lives in every zip code and COVID-19 is only making it worse. Unfortunately there’s no vaccine being developed to end this epidemic. In Congress I’ll continue to work to end this crisis and save lives. https://t.co/nCeGLg2JGT

COVID-19 combined with the Trump administration’s attempts to gut healthcare means it’s more important now than ever to ensure that rural communities have access to the life-saving treatments they need. https://t.co/KI0VLolg1C

The President postponing COVID relief until after the election is wrong and hurts Maryland families. I’m happy to see Gov. Hogan agree with me that the administration should act now to help families and businesses suffering through no fault of their own.  https://t.co/rLFuS74RHB

Over 20 million Americans are going hungry every week and the number will increase as COVID-19 continues to take its toll on our country and our economy. Many of these families rely on federal benefits to keep food on the table. https://t.co/qX9nrzsrOc

Overdose deaths are up 50% in Western Maryland during COVID-19. These numbers represent real people -- family friends neighbors and colleagues. There is much more work to do to end this crisis. https://t.co/k3qXpmlYJA

200000 dead. We should never have come close to this grave milestone. President Trump's total incompetence and utter lack of compassion when it comes to leading our country through the COVID-19 pandemic is sickening.  https://t.co/AbL63wSL8y
Now the President blames COVID-19 deaths in "blue states" like Maryland for making him look bad. To him the statistics and his politics are more important than those lives. https://t.co/aUfOcq4UBT

Our first responders have been fighting two public health crises recently: the COVID-19 pandemic and the opioid epidemic. Their dedication to public health and safety is critical to keeping our communities safe.  https://t.co/XydTIm9Qtl

Shockingly the Trump administration is taking away rather than investing in health safety – all while they push to open schools. Protecting students and educators from COVID-19 is key to opening schools safely. They need to get their priorities straight. https://t.co/Ubj09C7Ivg

.@JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris are the winning team we need to move America forward. In Congress I’ve worked with Senator Harris on efforts to support the most vulnerable communities during the COVID-19 pandemic. This is only the beginning of what we can accomplish. #BidenHarris https://t.co/wxr8xZqY3c

@JoeBiden and @KamalaHarris are the winning team we need to move America forward. In Congress I’ve worked with Senator Harris on efforts to support the most vulnerable communities during COVID-19 pandemic. This is only the beginning of what we can accomplish. #BidenHarris https://t.co/hcIwGBytKR

Last weekend Team Trone joined Brothers Academy and various other community organizations to distribute food to over 1000 MoCo families in need. So many families are struggling during the COVID-19 pandemic and the Brothers stepped up and served when they saw a need. https://t.co/nNg8ARsqBD

One thing I learned in business and in Congress is that good leaders turn to the experts for advice. Dr. Fauci has proven over his decades of service that his expertise is critical to our advances in medical research and responses to crises like COVID-19. https://t.co/GyagrCWnwD

Access to reliable internet is critical to families in the 6th District and the COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted this need even more. That’s why I’m proud that the House passed H.R. 2 which includes over $100 billion in funding for rural broadband. https://t.co/7onefhxEZo

LGBTQ+ youth are at a higher risk for mental health problems and suicide housing and employment discrimination and violence. These statistics are even more alarming for LGBTQ+ people of color and the COVID-19 pandemic has only made this problem worse.

This was no joke. While thousands of people are still dying from COVID-19 the President stood up and bragged about slowing down testing. This behavior is shameless and dangerous. We need leaders focused on public health not cheers at a rally.  https://t.co/T4hBLr28bM

COVID-19 is exposing critical weaknesses in our mental health care system and it’s past time we address this in Congress. My op-ed explains what all of us no matter who or where can do for those struggling with their mental health. https://t.co/Xoyg36Ocm2

This #EMSWeek we honor our first responders who dedicate themselves to protecting their communities every. While their efforts have been highlighted throughout the COVID-19 pandemic these men & women devote themselves to others regardless of the circumstances. Thank you!

There are so many great organizations working to support our communities and lift us up during the COVID-19 pandemic. My team has put together this resource guide to assist you in getting the help you need to stay safe and healthy.  https://t.co/t9Tgyjk46J
